properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST until January 14 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River near Nora.
* from Sunday morning to Tuesday afternoon.
* At  8:00 AM Friday the stage was 4.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Sunday morning and continue to
rise to near 14.0 feet by late Sunday night.  It will fall below
flood stage by late Monday night.
* At 14.0 feet...High water closes East 77th Street near Mystic Bay.
River Road floods. River Edge Lane and River Road just north of
86th Street flood.  Lowest residential areas begin to flood on
River Edge Lane.  High water staff gage readings begin at 14 feet
and continue to 25 feet.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
